column4: How exactly do I get the Fiesty LiveCD Install Partitioner thing to make a partition for ubuntu out of some free space on my windows NTFS partition?
How exactly do I get the Fiesty LiveCD Install Partitioner thing to make a partition for ubuntu out of some free space on my windows NTFS partition?
I believe you have to have ntfs-3g installed to write to a NTFS partition
So goto accessories --> terminal sudo aptitiude install ntfs-3g
Clearzen: You mean install ubuntu on an NTFS File system?
No to resize it
You want to use ext3 for the ubuntu partition
Clearzen: Okay, yeah. Thats what I'm trying to do. I'll try that.
Thanks
np

Clearzen: I tried sudo aptitiude install ntfs-3g, but it said command not found, so I tried sudo apt-get install ntfs-3g and it ran through about 4 lines of stuff and said it couldn't find the package

Clearzen: I tried sudo aptitiude install ntfs-3g, but it said command not found, so I tried sudo apt-get install ntfs-3g and it ran through about 4 lines of stuff and said it couldn't find the package

Clearzen: I tried sudo aptitiude install ntfs-3g, but it said command not found, so I tried sudo apt-get install ntfs-3g and it ran through about 4 lines of stuff and said it couldn't find the package
I'm not entirely sure you need it in the first place to install but to download it enable the univery repos
One sec I'll give you directions
Thanks
btw it's aptitude I spelled it wrong the first time
Clearzen: Ahh, I'll try that then
Go to system>>administration>>settings>>repositories> click them all and update
Tru7h:Go to system>>administration>>settings>>repositories> click them all and update
then sudo aptitude install ntfs-3g
Clearzen: I don't see "settings"
sorry you have to go to Synaptic Package Manager first
then settings
